abstract_summ: Based on the analysis of the empirical data for the number of infections in more than 20 countries we propose here a hitherto unknown universal model for the spreading of the COVID-19 pandemic that depends not on time, but on the number of infections itself.A mathematical model that can be used to estimate the total number of cases and deaths due to COVID-19 pandemic is presented in this study.The parameters and the associated uncertainty in the model are optimized and quantified using various reported data sets reported from different countries.The SIR (susceptible-infected-removed) model, statistical approach to the parameter identification and the official WHO daily data about the confirmed cumulative number of cases were used to make some estimations for the dynamics of the coronavirus pandemic dynamics in Ukraine, Italy and Austria.The objective of this study was to quantify the acceleration of daily confirmed cases and death curves using the polynomial interpolation method.
title_summ: Long-term predictions for COVID-19 pandemic dynamics in Ukraine, Austria and ItalyCOVID-19 pandemic: A Hill type mathematical model predicts the US death number and the reopening dateA universal generic description of the dynamics of the current COVID-19 pandemicCovid-19 growth rate analysis: application of a low-complexity tool for understanding and comparing epidemic curves
title_abstract_phrases: COVID-19 pandemic: A Hill type mathematical model predicts the US death number and the reopening dateA mathematical model that can be used to estimate the total number of cases and deaths due to COVID-19 pandemic is presented in this study.A universal generic description of the dynamics of the current COVID-19 pandemicBased on the analysis of the empirical data for the number of infections in more than 20 countries we propose here a hitherto unknown universal model for the spreading of the COVID-19 pandemic that depends not on time, but on the number of infections itself.Long-term predictions for COVID-19 pandemic dynamics in Ukraine, Austria and ItalyThe SIR (susceptible-infected-removed) model, statistical approach to the parameter identification and the official WHO daily data about the confirmed cumulative number of cases were used to make some estimations for the dynamics of the coronavirus pandemic dynamics in Ukraine, Italy and Austria.The parameters and the associated uncertainty in the model are optimized and quantified using various reported data sets reported from different countries.Covid-19 growth rate analysis: application of a low-complexity tool for understanding and comparing epidemic curvesINTRODUCTION: The acceleration of new cases is important for the characterization and comparison of epidemic curves.
